newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Four S.Korea banks, 25 officials warned over Hanbo.
newsitem.headline: Four S.Korea banks, 25 officials warned over Hanbo.

text.p: South Korea's Office of Bank Supervision (OBS) said on Tuesday it gave warnings to four banks and 25 bank officials for extending huge loans to Hanbo Steel Co without proper credit analysis.

The bank watchdog said in a statement the action would prevent Kim Shi-hyung, head of the state-run Korea Development Bank, and Chang Myung-son, president of Korea Exchange bank, from seeking re-appointment.
It said the four banks given the warnings included Korea First Bank, Cho Hung Bank, Korea Exchange Bank and Korea Development Bank.
The banks will face frequent inspections by the watchdog. The warnings will also be reflected in future performance evaluations, it said.
